item.title: Fade in / fade out in Qt/QML
item.description: This guide shows you how to add a fade in / fade out effect to a control in QML. There are a lot of built in animations in Qt/QML, but no fade in/fade out. Using a state machine and a `SequentialAnimation`, we can first animate the opacity, then set the visibility, achieving a fade in / fade out effect. Other ways like a `PropertyAnimation` are also available but are less expressive or configurable.
